revised_title: A Natural History of Minerals and Fossils
tldr: The author discusses the history of studying minerals and fossils, highlighting the works of notable naturalists like Conradus Gesnerus and Jacobus Wagnerus. They describe various types of fossils found in Switzerland, including sea shells, belemnites, and echinoderms, and provide illustrations of these specimens. The author also mentions the contributions of Vincentio Viviani in geometry and mechanics.
